trustfund:
TF050299-COFINANCING OF MACEDONIA
            EMERGENCY ECONOMIC RECOVERY CREIDT

abstracts.cdata!:
The achievement of project objectives is
            rated Highly Satisfactory. The objective was to support the
            restoration of assets and production levels immediately
            after the civil disturbances which had damaged the economy
            in mid- to late 2001. Specifically, the EERC financed 10-15
            percent of the incremental external financing gap for 2001
            and helped increase imports of critical goods. In addition
            to the general improvement in macroeconomic indicators, the
            EERC encouraged other donors to commit funds to FYR
            Macedonia. Project sustainability is likely. The overall
            performances of both the Bank and the Borrower are rated
            satisfactory. Two lessons derived from the project
            experience are cited: 1)   An Emergency Economic Recovery
            Credit provides a fast way to deliver urgently needed
            financial support through an investment channel in
            post-conflict environments.: The EERC was an appropriate
            vehicle because the funds were urgently needed. The funds
            were not linked to reforms, because neither was there time
            to negotiate reforms nor was there a political climate
            conducive to policy change. 2) A quick disbursing ERL type
            project can be justified even if the recovery program is
            eventually sidetracked. :. The macro framework became
            sidetracked in the fervor leading up to the September  2002
            elections. However, the activity of the EERC operation not
            only led to additional funding (US$  25 million from the
            Government of the Netherlands), it kept the donor community
            engaged and  encouraged them to make substantial commitments
            in March 2002. Though the program went off  track, the
            donors had a defined program to work with, which might
            facilitate future disbursements.
